Peripheral.Name: Embedded Flash
Peripheral.Description: The Flash memory interface manages CPU AHB I-Code and D-Code accesses to the Flash memory. It implements the erase and program Flash memory operations and the read and write protection mechanisms

Peripheral.Name: Data EEPROM
Peripheral.Description: Dummy config to support flash mapped at 0x0C000000

Peripheral.Name: OTP
Peripheral.Description: The Data OTP memory block. It contains the one time programmable bits.

Bit.Name: PRODUCT_STATE
Bit.Description: Life state code.

Bit.Name: PRODUCT_STATE
Bit.Description: Life state code.

Bit.Name: BORH_EN
Bit.Description: Brownout high enable configuration bit. Checked : BOR Level taken from BOR_LEV. Unchecked : BOR off
Bit.Val: disabled
enabled

Bit.Name: BORH_EN
Bit.Description: Brownout high enable configuration bit. Checked : BOR Level taken from BOR_LEV. Unchecked : BOR off
Bit.Val: disabled
enabled

Bit.Name: BOR_LEV
Bit.Description: Brownout level option status bit.

Values.Val: BOR Level 1, the threshold level is low (around 2.1 V)
BOR Level 2, the threshold level is medium (around 2.4 V)
BOR Level 3, the threshold level is high (around 2.7 V)

Bit.Name: BOR_LEV
Bit.Description: Brownout level option status bit.

Values.Val: BOR Level 1, the threshold level is low (around 2.1 V)
BOR Level 2, the threshold level is medium (around 2.4 V)
BOR Level 3, the threshold level is high (around 2.7 V)

Bit.Name: IO_VDDIO2_HSLV
Bit.Description: High-speed IO at low VDDIO2 voltage status bit.
Bit.Val: High-speed IO at low VDDIO2 voltage feature disabled (VDDIO2 can exceed 2.7 V)
High-speed IO at low VDDIO2 voltage feature enabled (VDDIO2 remains below 2.7 V)

Bit.Name: IO_VDDIO2_HSLV
Bit.Description: High-speed IO at low VDDIO2 voltage status bit.
Bit.Val: High-speed IO at low VDDIO2 voltage feature disabled (VDDIO2 can exceed 2.7 V)
High-speed IO at low VDDIO2 voltage feature enabled (VDDIO2 remains below 2.7 V)

Bit.Name: IO_VDD_HSLV
Bit.Description: High-speed IO at low VDD voltage status bit.
Bit.Val: High-speed IO at low VDD voltage feature disabled (VDD can exceed 2.7 V)
High-speed IO at low VDD voltage feature enabled (VDD remains below 2.7 V)

Bit.Name: IO_VDD_HSLV
Bit.Description: High-speed IO at low VDD voltage status bit.
Bit.Val: High-speed IO at low VDD voltage feature disabled (VDD can exceed 2.7 V)
High-speed IO at low VDD voltage feature enabled (VDD remains below 2.7 V)

Bit.Name: IWDG_STDBY
Bit.Description: Standby mode freeze option status bit.
Bit.Val: Independent watchdog frozen in system standby mode
Independent watchdog keep running in system standby mode.

Bit.Name: IWDG_STDBY
Bit.Description: Standby mode freeze option status bit.
Bit.Val: Independent watchdog frozen in system standby mode
Independent watchdog keep running in system standby mode.

Bit.Name: IWDG_STOP
Bit.Description: Stop mode freeze option status bit.
Bit.Val: Independent watchdog frozen in system Stop mode
Independent watchdog keep running in system Stop mode.

Bit.Name: IWDG_STOP
Bit.Description: Stop mode freeze option status bit.
Bit.Val: Independent watchdog frozen in system Stop mode
Independent watchdog keep running in system Stop mode.

Bit.Name: SWAP_BANK
Bit.Description: Bank swapping option status bit.
Bit.Val: bank 1 and bank 2 not swapped
bank 1 and bank 2 swapped

Bit.Description: Bank swapping option status bit.
Bit.Val: bank 1 and bank 2 not swapped
bank 1 and bank 2 swapped

Bit.Name: NRST_STOP
Bit.Description: Core domain Stop entry reset option status bit.
Bit.Val: a reset is generated when entering Stop mode on core domain
no reset generated when entering Stop mode on core domain

Bit.Name: SRAM1_ECC
Bit.Description: ECC in SRAM1 region configuration bit

Bit.Name: SRAM1_RST
Bit.Description: SRAM1 erase upon system reset

Values.Val: SRAM1 erased when a system reset occurs
SRAM1 not erased when a system reset occurs

Bit.Name: SRAM2_ECC
Bit.Description: ECC in SRAM2 region configuration bit

Bit.Name: BKPRAM_ECC
Bit.Description: ECC in BKPRAM region configuration bit

Bit.Name: SRAM2_RST
Bit.Description: SRAM2 erase when system reset

Values.Val: SRAM2 erase when system reset occurs
SRAM2 not erased when a system reset occurs

Bit.Name: NSBOOTADD
Bit.Description: Unique Boot Entry Address

Bit.Name: NSBOOT_LOCK
Bit.Description: A field locking the values of SWAP_BANK, and NSBOOTADD settings.

Values.Val: The SWAP_BANK and NSBOOTADD can still be modified following their individual rules.
The NSBOOTADD and SWAP_BANK are frozen.

Bit.Name: NSBOOTADD

Bit.Name: NSBOOT_LOCK

The NSBOOTADD and SWAP_BANK are frozen.
